page.title: 04EDUCATION
page.content: The Gellifor School building is very old.The school was opened in 1868,117 years ago.It has three classrooms,two of which have been joined.There is a large field,a small yard and a community centre which serves as a school hall and dining room. The school has 43 children,22 infants and 21 juniors.Of these,26 come to school by car,12 walk,1 comes by bike and 4 by taxi.The children come from Llandyrnog, Llangynhafal, Hendrerwydd and Gellifor itself.There are three teachers, one with the infants and two with the juniors.Four other people work at the school, two in the kitchen,one as secretary and one cleaner. Most of the children from Gellifor go to Brynhyfryd Secondary School in Ruthin, but a few go to Denbigh High School and Ruthin Private School.
